subject: Re: [Read_Alphabet] new font released
msgSnippet: ... Hi Oliver, As I wrote earlier, this problem stems from a bug in Mac OSX 10.4 font book, which thinks Thoth.ttf is not valid when it is. I fixed a few small
messageBody:
oliver langan wrote:
>
>
> Wow, so much traffic to come back to on this list. I've been traveling
> in China for several months (showing off the kids to my in-laws), but
> unlike Michael was not checking (all of) my email. It seems there are
> some great developments afoot.
>
> I downloaded the Thoth archive from the files section, and am getting an
> error when I try to install the Thoth.ttf file on my Mac. The font
> fails validation, and the error indicates that it is "Missing OpenType
> Data." ThothUni.ttf on the other hand installs correctly.
>

Hi Oliver,

As I wrote earlier, this problem stems from a bug in Mac OSX 10.4 font
book, which thinks Thoth.ttf is not valid when it is. I fixed a few
small kerning problems with Thoth, but more importantly for your sake, I
use so-called hinting with one font; that should create a hinting table,
and font book should not complain. I uploaded the font to the same place
as before (in the files=> fonts folder in the mailing list), so if you
could give it a try, I'd appreciate it.

Paul
